The slope of a line is also the ratio of vertical change to horizontal change between any two distinct points

children.terminal: \te{slope} = {\te{vertical change from A to B} \over \te{horizontal change from A to B}}

children.content: Indeed, dividing the vertical change by the horizontal change gives the per-horizontal-unit vertical change.
